greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of digits larger than 1 in primorial base expansion of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..32768
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
example: In primorial base (A049345), 87 is written as "2411" because 87 = 2*A002110(3) + 4*A002110(2) + 1*A002110(1) + 1*A002110(0) = 2*30 + 4*6 + 1*2 + 1*1. Only the digits 2 and 4 of these are larger than one, thus a(87) = 2.
program: (PARI) A328615(n) = { my(s=0, p=2); while(n, s += (1<(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (s); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 22 2019
